edu.ucla.sspace.clustering.criterion

Class BaseFunction

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ucla.sspace.clustering.criterion.BaseFunction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CriterionFunction
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    E1Function, G1Function, I1Function, I2Function

    public abstract class BaseFunction
extends Object
implements CriterionFunction
    This CriterionFunction implements the basic functionality needed for a majority of the functions available. It works by first gathering a handful of meta data for the data set, such as the cluster sizes, initial cluster assignments, and initial centroids. It then implements update and requires subclasses to implement functions for determining the change in the criterion score due to moving a data point.

    Sub classes must implement getOldCentroidScore and getNewCentroidScore. The first function returns the score for the current datapoints cluster assignment when that data point is removed from the data point. The second function returns the score for an anternate cluster when the current data point is placed in that cluster.

    This base class also provides two key methods for assisting with compute the above changes: modifiedMagnitudeSqrd and modifiedMagnitude. For both functions, the first method is cosidered to be the cluster centroid that is being modified and the second vector is the data point that is being added to the centroid, without actually affecting the cluster.
    Author:
    Keith Stevens

      Returns the magnitude of c as if v was added to the the vector.

        protected double[] costs
        The cost computed for each cluster. This is maintained seperatly so that update can modify only the two relevant clusters being modified.

      • setup

        public void setup(Matrix m,
         int[] initialAssignments,
         int numClusters)
        Creates the cluster centroids and any other meta data needed by this CriterionFunction.
        Specified by:
        setup in interface CriterionFunction
        Parameters:
        m - The Matrix holding data points. This will be used as read only.
        initialAssignments - The cluster assignments for each data point in m. This is used as read only and discarded.

      • subSetup

        protected void subSetup(Matrix m)
        Setup any extra information needed before computing the cost values for each cluster.

      • update

        public boolean update(int currentVectorIndex)
        Updates the clustering assignment for data point indexed by currentVectorIndex. This returns true if the data point is left in the same cluster and false if it was relocated to another data point.
        Specified by:
        update in interface CriterionFunction

      • getOldCentroidScore

        protected abstract double getOldCentroidScore(DoubleVector vector,
                         int oldCentroidIndex,
                         int altClusterSize)
        Returns the new score for the cluster centroid represented by altCurrentCentroid with the new altClusterSize.
        Parameters:
        altCurrentCentroid - The current updated cluster centroid
        altClusterSize - The current updated cluster size

      • getNewCentroidScore

        protected abstract double getNewCentroidScore(int newCentroidIndex,
                         DoubleVector dataPoint)
        Returns the new score for the cluster centroid indexed by newCentroidIndex when dataPoint is added to it. Implementations of this method should not actually add dataPoint to the centroid, but should instead use the helper functions provided to compute the new score.
        Parameters:
        newCentroidIndex - The index of the current alternate centroid
        dataPoint - The current data point that is being reassigned

      • updateScores

        protected void updateScores(int newCentroidIndex,
                int oldCentroidIndex,
                DoubleVector vector)

      • subtract

        protected static DoubleVector subtract(DoubleVector c,
                    DoubleVector v)
        Returns a DoubleVector that is equal to c - v. This method is used instead of the one in VectorMath so that a DenseDynamicMagnitudeVector can be used to represent the difference. This vector type is optimized for when many calls to magnitude are interleaved with updates to a few dimensions in the vector.

      • assignments

        public int[] assignments()
        Returns the cluster assignment indices for each data point in the original matrix passed to {@link #setup(Matrix, int[] int) setup).
        Specified by:
        assignments in interface CriterionFunction

        public double score()
        Returns the score computed by this CriterionFunction.
        Specified by:
        score in interface CriterionFunction

      • modifiedMagnitudeSqrd

        protected static double modifiedMagnitudeSqrd(DoubleVector c,
                           DoubleVector v)
        Returns the magnitude squared of c as if v was added to the vector. We do this because it would be more costly, garbage collection wise, to create a new vector for each alternate cluster and then throw away all but one of them.

      • modifiedMagnitude

        protected static double modifiedMagnitude(DoubleVector c,
                       DoubleVector v)
        Returns the magnitude of c as if v was added to the the vector. We do this because it would be more costly, garbage collection wise, to create a new vector for each alternate cluster and * vector.

      • subtractedMagnitudeSqrd

        protected static double subtractedMagnitudeSqrd(DoubleVector c,
                             DoubleVector v)
        Returns the magnitude squared of c as if v was added to the vector. We do this because it would be more costly, garbage collection wise, to create a new vector for each alternate cluster and then throw away all but one of them.

      • subtractedMagnitude

        protected static double subtractedMagnitude(DoubleVector c,
                         DoubleVector v)
        Returns the magnitude of c as if v was added to the the vector. We do this because it would be more costly, garbage collection wise, to create a new vector for each alternate cluster and * vector.
